results.title: An African community: the Masai
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardonyi, Clifford Janoff and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: This film shows how the nomadic Masai live in the highlands of East Africa. It describes their dependence on the land, their adaptation to the environment, and their family and tribal interdependence. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: An Affair to remember [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Leo McCarey, Jerry Wald and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Debonair playboy Nickie Ferrante (Cary Grant) and beautiful nightclub singer Terry McKay (Deborah Kerr) meet travelling first class aboard a transatlantic luxury liner courtesy of two other people. She is a tycoon’s mistress and he is engaged to an heiress. Their sudden, but undeniable love affair leads them to make a vow - that they will break off their current relationships, get jobs and meet in six months to continue their affair. However, a tragic accident prevents Terry from keeping their rendezvous and the lovers future takes an emotional and uncertain turn. This film is a remake of Leo McCarey’s “Love Story” and Vic Damone croons the title tune on the soundtrack.

results.title: An Actor's revenge
results.creator_credit: Kon Ichikawa, Masaichi Nagata and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: Starring Kazuo Hasegawa, a Japanese matinee idol, this is the story of a kabuki actor who plans a long suffering revenge on the men who drove his parents to suicide. A melodrama, this film jumps from the swooning romanticism of the kabuki and its traditional music to stylised action and Hollywood jazz. At the centre of this, Hasegawa brushes aside his advancing years and delivers performances of enduring skill and charm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kon Ichikawa, Masaichi Nagata and Daiei Motion Picture Company

results.title: Amy!
results.creator_credit: Peter Wollen, Laura Mulvey and Modelmark
results.brief_description: Part newsreel and part biography, this film takes as its subject, the life story of the legendary aviatrix Amy Johnson who was the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia. Mulvey and Wollen pursue their concern, developing radical strategies through a sustained discussion, by a women’s group, of what the “heroic” image means to women including questions of feminism and representation. A commentary on ‘philovatism’ (the desire for thrills) seeks to explain Johnson’s exploits in psychoanalytic terms. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Amy is a tiger
results.creator_credit: Keith Hall and Cameracraft Film Productions
results.brief_description: A promotional film for industrial development in Queensland. A Canadian, visiting Queensland to report on business prospects and industrialization, charters Amy, an elderly Tiger Moth, to take him to the industrially important areas of the State.

results.title: Amore
results.brief_description:
Michel, a young architect is sent by the French government to Venice with a mision to try and find a solution to save an island. Paolo, a young photographer, offers to help Michel in his discovery of the city. He also introduces him to the beautiful Marina.

Credits: Director, Henry Chapier ; writers, Anne Capelle, Henry Chapier ; photoraphy, Alain Derobe ; music, Vangelis Papathanassiou.
Cast: Sonia Petrova, Daniel Quenaud, Julian Negulesco, Henri Deus, Daniel Ceccaldi.

results.title: Among the Hardwoods
results.creator_credit: Lyn Maplestone and Commonwealth of Australia
results.brief_description: An earlier silent version of this film was made in 1927 as part of the ‘Know Your Own Country’ series by renowned pioneer cinematographer Lacey Percival. In mid-1936 Bert Ive and a sound recordist revisited the Pemberton region of south-west Western Australia where they filmed and also recorded natural sounds from the forest. Whilst this re-edited film was half the length of the original, Ive’s director Lyn Maplestone created greater impact by lingering on the sights and sounds of logging trees in the Jarrah and Karri forests. The film focuses on the atmosphere of the forest as it was irrevocably changed by the axe and saw of the loggers. Scenes shot for the silent version (but not always used) can also be seen being processed and screened in ‘Telling the World’ (1929). Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection.

results.title: Amisk
results.creator_credit: Alanis Obomsawin, Dorothy Courtois, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A week-long festival was organised by a group of Montreal citizens to raise funds in support of the Cree Indians who stood to lose their land because of the James Bay hydro-electric project. This film alternates between the spectacular performances of the Indian and Inuit peoples and the meeting halls of Mistassini where they talk of their past to defend their future.

results.title: American Rebel
results.creator_credit: Will Roberts and United Documentary Films
results.brief_description: Biographical documentary of an all-American boy who turned communist pop star, Dean Reed. Reed, who lived for many years in East Germany, became the number one popular male singer in the Soviet bloc, and certain South American countries. This film tries to find out what motivated Reed to turn Red. Note: Program has black sub-titles which are difficult to read in sections.
